title.narrative: Emergency Preventive and Curative Nutrition Support Intervention for Drought affected communities in uncovered areas in Waqooyi-Galbeed Region.

description.narrative:
This proposal is for the Provision of quality integrated nutrition services in selected health facilities in Waqooyi-Galbeed targeting acutely malnourished drought affected lt5 years (boys and girls) and pregnant and lactating women through supporting 6 Health Facilities (HFs) and 1 Stabilization Centter (SC) in uncovered locations in Waqooyi Galbeed Region of North-West of Somalia. The intervention services will continue for 12 months and will include: 1. The identification, referral and treatment of 2,425 children suffering from acute malnutrition through Outpatient Therapeutic Program (OTP) facility based Services, referral to Therapeutic Supplementary Feeding Program (TSFP) and community based approaches. 2. The project will strengthen local technical capacity for integration of Integrated Management of Acute Malnutrition (IMAM) into the Primary Health Care system through utilization of Basic Nutrition Services Package (BNSP). 3. Strategies are strengthening supply chain management, well-trained health workers, financing, and use of existing community based nutrition programs in order to scale-up prevention, early identification and treatment of acute malnutrition of children and Pregnant and Lactating (PLW). 4. Service delivered will be Maternal and child nutrition components including IMAM, IYCF, NHHP, referral system, Ready to Use Therapeutic Food (RUTF) supplies, nutrition surveillance and as well as mobilizing, educating and creating demand for service uptake. 5. Prevention services will include de-worming, counseling and promotion on infant and young child feeding including Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) in emergencies. Community mobilization, screening and referral, micro-nutrient supplementation for PLW (multiple micro-nutrients and Iron Folate), Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) and U5 (Vitamin A supplements) for children reinforced with Communication for development (C4D). 6. To protect breastfeeding, Breast-Milk Substitutes (BMS) donations are not requested or accepted. 7. The project will support 1 Stabilization Centre in Jog-Wajaale of Gebiley District to treat referred Complicated Severely Acute Malnourished (SAM) children. To enhance increased coverage of Emergency nutrition services, Stabilization Centre in Tog-Wajaale Hospital will be established in respect to Admission criteria to SC, 3 Phases of Nutrition rehabilitation, length of stay, Surveillance and household follow up and Treatment of medical complications all will be conducted as per the IMAM guidelines for Somalia. 8. The project is a nutrition specific putting into practice to standard IMAM Guidelines and protocols in respect to strategic objectives of Somali humanitarian response plan. In collaboration with the nutrition cluster it support to existing programs at community and facility level.
9. The intervention protects children and women by fostering resilience to prepare absorb shocks, through adaptive learning, collective action, cohesion and self-reliance.
